text: have you won today I'm making like a Bop
guy or a chicken salad with cabbage it's
a very popular Vietnamese salad that you
can serve as an appetizer or with some
chicken congee yeah yeah let's begin for
the chicken you can buy chicken breast
in Vietnam they don't sell chicken
breast separately so I have to buy the
whole chicken like this I rub it with
some salt and some smack ginger to
remove the strong powdery smell and then
brings the chicken inside out with tap
water I'm gonna remove the chicken thigh
and drumstick for another dish and also
the wings so we're going to use just the
body parts of the chicken cook the
chicken with a teaspoon of salt and half
a peach onion for about 15 to 20 minutes
until is cooked through for the salad
you're going to need some Vietnamese
mint rogram shallot carrot some cabbage
half a yellow onion some lime and
chilies and also some crispy fried
shallots to enhance the flavor of the
chicken meat we always add lime leaf you
can also use the kaffir lime leaves that
you can buy frozen aeration store roll
them up like a cigar and then cut into
really things threads also cut the onion
crosswise into really thin slices and
then soak in add cold water to reduce
the strong onion smell and also to keep
it really crisp cut the cabbage in
quarters then cut off the stem at a
forty-five degree angle to create a base
to keep the cabbage piece stable while
we spread it into really fine strips
this is such a perfect way to shred
cabbage that I plants from a Japanese
lady on YouTube and I've been loving it
ever since
when a chicken is cooked through take it
out and let cool completely before we
remove the skin and shred the chicken
breasts into strips the chicken will
taste a lot better if you shred by hand
rather than slide into strips because
the dressing and seasoning is going to
absorb into the fiber grains of the
chicken meat
to make the salad dressing in a bowl
we're going to mix together two
tablespoons of sugar with three
tablespoons of fish sauce
also screens about one to two
tablespoons of lime juice depending on
how sour you want your cellar to be and
then give it a good stir to have the
sugar dissolve then add the minced
garlic and chilli so they will float on
top the dressing should have the balance
between sweet sour and savory perfect
just amble the cellar we're going to add
one cup of the shredded chicken and mix
with about three tablespoons of the
dressing some crab peppers and the lime
leaf threads mix well before you add one
cup of carrot one co-op's light onion
and two cups of shredded cabbage now add
more dressing addressing to your taste
give it a really good toss
oops I forgot to add in the lime leaves
earlier so I'm going to add in now
actually you should mix it with the
shredded chicken first mix well and set
aside until you serve have a taste and
only add about a cup to a cup and a half
of the chopped Vietnamese mint as the
last step
finally you can add the crispy fried
shallots and saving some for garnish
later now it's ready to serve you can
just transfer it to a serving plate top
with some fried shallots crack peppers
and some chilli slices mmm yum yum by
